lead_paragraph: The defending champion Rafael Nadal defeated the 18-year-old Donald Young in their first meeting, and James Blake evened his record against his familiar foe Carlos Moyà in third-round matches at the Pacific Life Open in Indian Wells, Calif.Nadal won, 6-1, 6-3. Blake took a methodical 6-3, 6-4 victory against Moyà, who at 31 had been the oldest player left in the men’s side of the tournament..The two-time women’s title winner Lindsay Davenport, who often seemed her own worst enemy, bounced back from a second-set loss and had to overcome 48 unforced errors to defeat Chan Yung-Jan, 6-4, 5-7, 6-2. Jelena Jankovic, the women’s No. 3 seed, romped to a 6-1, 6-1 victory against Ai Sugiyama.
